questions.question: What about documenting the file closing paragraphs 9100-XREFFILE-CLOSE (541-556), 9200-DISCGRP-CLOSE (559-574), 9300-ACCTFILE-CLOSE (577-592), and 9400-TRANFILE-CLOSE (595-610), which are performed at lines 225-228 with error handling similar to opens?

The paragraphs section lists 1300-COMPUTE-INTEREST as calling 1300-B-WRITE-TX (performed line 468), but 1300-B-WRITE-TX (473-515) and the called Z-GET-DB2-FORMAT-TIMESTAMP (613-626, performed line 496) are not documented as separate paragraphs. Why omitted?
Does the documentation for TCATBAL-FILE input note that sequential processing assumes records are sorted by account ID (FD-TRANCAT-ACCT-ID) for correct grouping via change detection at line 194?

In data_flow reads_from ACCOUNT-FILE, fields_used citation includes 352 (ADD to ACCT-CURR-BAL during update) and 210 (MOVE ACCT-GROUP-ID out); line 372 is the READ. Are these accurate for 'fields_used' from reads?

In error_handling citations for open errors, line 281 displays 'ERROR OPENING DALY REJECTS FILE' but this is for DISCGRP-FILE open (0200-DISCGRP-OPEN). Should documentation note this code discrepancy?
